messages.content: Transcript Segment: "And so, when I was asked to write the foreword, I said this is my good fortune! It is not just a privilege, it is my good fortune that I got an opportunity to express my devotion for him. I have spoken so much about him, in the last week in Dharampur. I could not contain myself, I felt I would be unable to on this day. During the revision sessions, during the spiritual retreats... Today, my wish is to convey to you, the gist of the entire content contained in this book. And then... Most of all, his inward focus and his neutrality. And his devotion... Perhaps he may not be sitting and singing hymns, but his reverence for the enlightened ones, and reverence for that experience which the enlightened ones point to; and his inclination for the spiritual practice of being soul-focused; these three things have worked magic in my life. And so, taking a small 'Vachanamrut' - statement by Param Krupalu Dev, I'll convey the gist of the entire book, 'Atmajnan ane Sadhanapath'. It must have been nearly 15-17 years since I last read it; or it could even be 20 years. Param Krupalu Dev, in Updeshchhaya... Updeshchhaya-10, on Bhadarva Sud 15, 1952, at Vadva, Param Krupalu Dev states: The essence of all religions is... The essence of all religions is to experience the soul. All other spiritual means, wherever needed (are appropriate), when practised as per the enlightened one's command, bear fruit for the worthy soul. It is as if this Vachanamrut is elaborated in... I won't say book, now I will call it a scripture. In this scripture, Munishri has explained based on his own experience. A beautiful style of expression is also appealing, but it's as if every word is from his inner experience. And yet, he is nowhere in the book. That is wondrous - it is his experience, but... In earlier books, he would write: Mu. Amarendravijay. 'Until I reach the 6th - 7th stage of spiritual development, until there is abidance in the self, beyond thoughts, how am I a 'muni' - monk?' To have such a definition of a muni, while adorning the garbs of a muni, shows he was a lover of the soul. He did nothing just for the sake of society or public recognition. In our 'Puranas' - ancient legends, especially the Mahabharat, there is a saying: 'Dharmo rakshati rakshatah' - Dharma protects those who protect it. It is be found in the Manusmriti and in the Mahabharat, this aphorism holds an especially important place. And its meaning is: Dharma will protect you if you protect dharma. If dharma is woven into your life, in your thoughts and actions; if in life, it reflects in your state, then surely that dharma will protect you."

Transcript Segment: "Because what we do there, and what we do at home... He does not feel that there is any benefit in practising dharma. On the basis of the external form, in short, the poppy-seeds - we create conflicts, we start discriminating. The actual essence lies in the inner form of dharma. Hence, Param Krupalu Dev writes: The essence of all religions... It must be dharma. Then the names of its external forms are not mentioned. The essence of all religions is to experience the soul. That's all. All spiritual means are negated? The answer is no! All other spiritual means, wherever appropriate, practise as per the enlightened one's command, then it will bear fruit for the worthy soul. In order to attain this fruit, meaning realising the soul, experiencing the self, to taste the soul in a state beyond thoughts, then one must have the correct determination of the fundamental truth. Because the task to be performed is only one: From being externally focused to soul focused. But no matter how much we resolve, due to lack of worthiness, being externally focused is not averted, even if we sit with closed eyes for three hours! Even if we sit in 'samayak' - Jain ritual. None of this is wrong, but my objective isn't achieved. So it is necessary to understand that the work is only this: go from externally focused to soul focused. But if the stages are not properly understood, then we will get stuck. And if we remain stuck for a long time, we might go astray! If nothing happens, there is no experience... The name of the book is Experience... Have you heard of such a name anywhere? I really feel that at all our airports, everywhere... You try to ensure this becomes a bestseller. I know when the exposition on Atmasiddhi Shastra was published, any airport of India I would go, I would see Param Krupalu Dev's book and Atmasiddhi. The first... It might have helped; at least, the real seekers. Might be, others are not interested. But if we can make this available to even the few interested, then it can be said that we expressed our devotion for infinite enlightened ones. So, I am not saying this for you. I am not saying this for you all. When you all are not there, I will sing his praises even more. Right now, I am limiting myself; since you are writing, I am limiting myself. When you all are not there, I will praise with all my heart. And it's a must-read! Usually those were the times, means in '85 to '90s, I used to read 100 pages a day. And to read a scripture every month - that still continues till date... A scripture, but if it is a big scripture, then a chapter; that continues till date."

Transcript Segment: "Come to the US, I want to work on Sachin. He asked, "No, five centres today morning, the name is out 9:30." Why did it come at 6:30? Everything, one by one, centre final, Ghatkopar went, Mulund went, Borivali went. One more place, when centre cross, I think, why? But because from November, I have taken three days' date at one place, I stay at some man's house for three days in that area, young student will take me to drink something at night, so during the day we will do Pratishtha, Satsang, this, but only of that area allowed, and Ghatkopar, Mulund, going to Ghatkopar, he is scared, but I will be fine. And then I could walk through, yes, our B group, then I will come every time to your place, and all the age group people will do Satsang together, so today is the Ghatkopar day, tomorrow is a Mulund day, I think, one BK Seema is also doing something somewhere. I think, but I haven't gone yet, but the whole day was there, so finalised everything, and Sachin did his interiors and everything. I have assigned this to naturopathy, seven girls I am keeping. Only seven girls, they make the whole naturopathy centre. Design, then give it to the seven boys, they will construct it. Then they give it back to these seven girls and I have said seven because in Gujarati, when spoken in English, it sounds like 'sukh'. Seven, say one by one, we all 1 seven 1 eight, let my seven remain, so Ajit, so Dipali is there, Sneha is there, well, Reena is there, all back and work, Amm Riya, Ellie dude, because a lot of them will have means America is they have to go north, south, east, west, India, visit so many places, because I think naturopathy will, I had already said it, 20 years back, one day will come when you will see more whites than Indians in the ashram. We have a little, little, little, but with this naturopathy, I think it will be a very good place for yoga and this and whole big plot next to meditation is going to be a huge naturopathy centre. Five-star hotel-like buildings, five nests, nests at basically luxury cottages, bungalows, everything and affordable, everything. Then therapy centre, then yoga court, then their own kitchen and dining. At least in December, I have to do the ground-breaking ceremony. This December, so before that, all the designs and everything there will be Bombay therapy, Korean therapy, Japanese therapy and all. If you have any problem, even a physical problem, come to the Dharampur Ashram. You have you have anxiety issues, panic attack, depression, so naturopathy will help you everywhere. They go to Rishikesh because there is a three-day program that with these therapies, you go off medicine"

Transcript Segment: "Just because you are sitting for six hours in meditation, you don't go... You are not considered ahead. So, 'What are the points which I need to check?' 'What do I need to check?' All this. Do you want a spiritual map? Because in the world of saints, you are never going to be evaluated by your activities. You are going to be evaluated only by your virtues. Therefore, if you are busy 24 hours also and done all the satsang, "Had you not come, you would have benefitted more." The Enlightened One should not have to say this. Param Krupalu Dev was very strict about this. Someone asked me: "What did Param Krupalu Dev look like?" "Did He look as serious as He does in the photograph?" I replied, "Such a countenance, that you are bound to be mesmerised!" "Whether He speaks or not, you would not feel like moving away." Then I spoke for 30 minutes. But I said, "In His fundamentals, He was very strict." If He thought you are the wrong person here, He would say, "Just get out." Not even a little... This itself was His compassion. You may be the most important person in seva, or whatever you are; He would say: Just leave! Before afternoon. I don't want to see your face. Means, before afternoon you need to leave. To say this, He would not hesitate one bit. Because He was very focused, and He wanted focused people around Him. He didn't want thousands of people, He wanted focused people. So when it comes to spirituality, you would shiver in front of Him. But when it comes to love, you will just... Just remembering him is like falling in love. A seeker of liberation will think: 'What did I do with the last information?' Now, I am calling satsang as information. 'What did I do with the last information?' How did you apply the last satsang in your life? Otherwise, I'm not eligible to go for the next. An information-seeker does not have such a problem; for him - compilation, and taking it a little ahead, he is desirous to show off. So many nuns attend the discourse, are writing non-stop. One likes it in the sense that they have such a deep interest in this subject that they are writing non-stop. It is not because it is spoken by me, but they are keen to write it down. They anyway would be studying scriptures so much, yet are doing this. Later, when I meet them separately to respect them, and mention that I noticed you were writing. They reply, "Yes, these examples would be useful in our discourses." Now you tell me, though they are in the attire of a renunciate, but are they information-seekers or seeker of liberation? What is the reason for listening?"

Transcript Segment: "My heartfelt and delightful salutations to 'Munishri' - Pujya Amarendravijayji. I was first introduced to him in 1985 at Deolali. In the very first meeting, he appeared different. His spiritual bent, his inner focus... He was so detached; and yet, in the first meeting itself, he felt so close to me. To feel love for a detached person... And at that time... What would my age have been? In '85? Yes, 19 years. Those were the times when I stayed in caves; and during that time, in a sanatorium called Pranam Sankalp in Deolali... It felt very different. And then the acquaintance continued in Tithal; we remained in contact until 1991. I received the Gujarati book, 'Atmajnan ane Sadhanapath' from him. That was a time when Gujarati was very difficult for me; and yet, as I kept reading each page, I underlined almost every line. Every line! To the extent that I could never give my copy to anyone to read. And I had the feeling: this is my Bible, I told Ramzanbhai as well that this is my Bible. Later, I studied it many times. To many... Almost to everyone who comes for an 8-10 day stay and is a true seeker, and wants to commence the pursuit of being soul-focused and dispassionate, he must read this for a minimum of three times. And I experienced that in understanding my own Guru's words, in a genuine sense, it was a guide. Many times, for your college exams, you just read the guide and appear, and you would pass as well. That itself was my goal. The method might be different, but the direction was the same. Due to his blessings and being in his company, it felt like he was someone who has had a higher experience. Many times, we would sit for hours! In those times, I had not seen something like this in the community of monks; I am talking of myself. And therefore, there was such a deep impact on me, of both, his personality and literature - his words. Even today, if you ask me where something is, or where an example is in the book, then, at least I can tell you whether it is on the left page or the right page. It has had a very deep impact on my soul, on my spiritual pursuit. And so, when I was asked to write the foreword, I said this is my good fortune! It is not just a privilege, it is my good fortune that I got an opportunity to express my devotion for him. I have spoken so much about him, in the last week in Dharampur. I could not contain myself, I felt I would be unable to on this day. During the revision sessions, during the spiritual retreats..."

Transcript Segment: "No, you don't need to change. Those who want to attain liberation should change. Why do you need to change always? Those who want to attain liberation, they should change. You are walking on the road and there is a stone pillar on the way; while going on the pavement. You are the president. Abhaybhai, you are the president of the Mission, and there is a pillar in the way. Will you say, "Why should I change my path? "I am the president, the pillar should move". Do you want to hit your head on the pillar? Then change your route, change your thinking; that's it. If a snake is coming towards you, will you say, "I am the chief merchant in the city, why should I move aside?" Those who want to survive, those who want to escape from the bondage of karma, they need to change. Why do you need to change always? If you desire liberation all day, then change. My father passed away in 2002. I am talking about before 1985, say, 1979-1980. I was very dear to my mother. So, my mother would come to me for any decision or solution. Once she came and said, "Today is Sunday. I told father to take us out somewhere but he said he wanted to rest." My father was a little lazy. He didn't like dramas, movies, restaurants, anything. He liked staying at home. My mother said, "We are at home from Monday to Saturday. So, take us out on Sunday." Who is right, who is wrong, whatever. If there would come a "No" from there, she would be unable to do anything there, so she would come to me. She used to call me Babul then. She would complain, "See Babul, father is doing this." I said, "Mother, you know father's nature. So, you change your thoughts." She started crying more. She said, "I came to You for solace, and You are advising me only! Father is at fault and You are pointing out my fault." I replied, "Why do you keep such desires? You came to me, so I am giving you advice. Whoever comes to me, I give him advice." Whoever goes to the doctor for medicine, he gets medicine. You came to me, so... 'Why I should change?' Because you want to get liberated fast. So, the duty of a seeker is: Settle down quickly. If any problem arises, if the mind becomes restless, settle down fast. This should be your 'sadhana' - spiritual practice. If religion is a science, this is your sadhana. Settle down. Close your files, accounts. To close accounts, give the other person a 100% discount. It is not his fault at all; it is my past karma, my current expectations, so... Give them a 100% discount and do your work. So, focus on what is your business."

Transcript Segment: "Now, at the bud stage, the impurities are being detected at a very early stage: 'Something is not good within me. Something... I am not feeling so connected to the Lord or the pure soul, or whatever. There is some impurity in me already, I need to find out the culprit.' So, your awareness keeps increasing, now you reach a level where you have started to think about thoughts. Earlier, you were too caught up in individuals or events. Then you learned something new - the karma theory. You didn't get time because you were too busy analysing karma. Now all that is gone, so you start thinking about thoughts. 'What is this thought?' You realise that it has no independent existence. It has no life of its own, it increases when I identify with it, it disappears when I disassociate from it. When it disappears, I experience a glimpse of happiness. So, now what should I do? At 9.40, you have to come to this conclusion. Only three things: I am not the thoughts, the thoughts are not mine, I have no relationship with thoughts. Simple. 1. I am not the thoughts, 2. The thoughts are not mine, 3. I have no relationship with thoughts. I have no relation with them. Like we say, "We have no relation with Sureshbhai." Have we given our daughter to you? Have we taken in your daughter? We have no relation. There is a lot of love, but no relation. So, I am not the thoughts, the thoughts are not mine. (I have no relationship with thoughts.) Consider that you are a manager of a 'dharmashala' - dormitory, where you will stay for a month now. Manager. There is some caretaker of a dharmashala. It is a dharmashala so people come, stay for a night, then leave. So, he does not evaluate them. 'How much would this party be worth? Would they be from North Gujarat or South?' For him, the charge is ₹500 or ₹1000 if they choose AC; the charge for dharmashala is ₹1000. Now we have changed it. At the ashram we used to say 'dharmashala', Maulikji still belongs to those times. He says, "Five new dharmashalas are in the works." I said, "Prabhu, people think of dharmashala as a place with a pot lying around and a small cot. These days, people don't like this word. Call it a guest house." But he still calls it dharmashala. We travel a lot, so we know that... If you tell the elite crowd that you have booked their room in a dharmashala, they say, "No, I will stay at Iris. I will stay outside at the hotel." We say, "Our dharmashala is very good, at least take a look." As long as it's a dharmashala... 'We have come for dharma, but we will not stay in a dharmashala.'"

Transcript Segment: "So, I do not stay for more than a day. So, from that perspective, culture and... They study Atmasiddhi! Every verse, verse by verse; because it is in English, they can study it. That girl did not know English. She learnt English by seeing English movies with subtitles. Through that, she learnt English from Korean. And now she knows it so fluently, she's studying Atmasiddhi. And the way she chanted the verses, even you may not be able to pronounce it so clearly. She is blessed and even you have benefitted, you can retire from everywhere and come to Dharampur. She comes 12 times a year, now it will decrease. Because she will stay there more, so to come... She has got such daughters-in-law who will keep both her sons on the path of religion. This is a great merit! Great ones... you understood... See, it is very clear that by the association of great ones, some, "Om..." They will perform some magic, and you will attain self-realisation, nothing. They are catalytic agents. In the presence of electricity, hydrogen and oxygen will become water. It does not contribute anything to that, and without it, it will not happen. They are catalytic agents. The instrumental cause will not do anything, but without it, it won't happen. This is very clear that all the effort must be made by you, but the main basis of that effort is the nectar-like words, countenance, and the association of the great ones. Now, it only says association. If such a small nectar-like teaching has to be written, why write 3? Do we get nectar-like words during association or not? And do we get to behold His countenance or not? Everything is included in the association of the great ones. It should be of the great ones, the great ones. "Oh! This is what is unique in Shrimad's philosophy?" Someone asked me. "You'll don't study scriptures?" I said, "We do." "You'll meditate?" I said, "We do." "You'll perform austerities?" I said, "We do." "Do you go on pilgrimages?" I said, "After 'Paryushan' - Jain festival, I have a vow for 57 years to visit one place of pilgrimage and one saint. I have followed it till now. I will go immediately." Transcript Segment: "that if it has been given, then the mind, speech, and body definitely unite in following it. If it has not been given, then, 'When will I receive a command? When will I receive a command?' When it is received, without any indolence or excuse, with the unison of all three energies... And that too, the inner intention is grasped because if the inner intention is grasped, only then will the enlightened one be recognised. Otherwise you will remain a beggar because discernment will not awaken in you. So, keep the habit of understanding the intention of the command, not the habit of asking for commands. Because after some time, your next phase will start when you are given separation. True love has not awakened; that is why separation is not given because then you will run to the world. You develop a little true love... What is it called? 'Modus operandi'? Am I saying it rightly? This is fixed; the eternal style of the enlightened ones - that love has awakened in him, now to send him to the second level, give separation. At that time, who will you ask for commands? As the intention behind the command is understood, discernment awakens accordingly. Due to your knowledge... Gradually, there will be no need to ask, and I see a lot in Nemiji. A lot in Nemiji. He will know what I will think, not only what I am thinking. So, of course, due to close acquaintance. More contribution of that, but he has always made a conscious attempt of, 'I want to ask lesser and lesser and be aligned to Him more and more.' But ask lesser and lesser. For GPS, Kothari said, "There is a half-hour meeting." I said, "Firstly, start conducting meetings while standing. And finish it in half a minute. If you have brought a 500 crore project, I will let you sit." For a day's programme, when they sit cross-legged, my horns stand up. Now, he needs to be brought back in line. What is there to discuss? Ask while on the way to the lift. Only the one with doership needs more time. If you have grasped the inner intention, then, 'This will be chosen. This will be said 'yes' to.' You know before the answer comes. Very very important. So many times you will feel that breaking the command is beneficial right now. From a worldly perspective, physical perspective, financial perspective, family perspective, whatever. 'If I break the command and be a little practical, then...' Benefit will be seen in breaking the command. An aspirant will not see that. Even a loss in following the command, he will see it as a profit. There was a watchman. What does he have to do? At least say that much."
